content: >http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/europe/article6052601.ece Wonder what position Moscow will be taking on Moldova? Will they allow the 'commies' to take power after a national election? Or will they side with the voice of democracy rioting in the streets?

content: Turns out that 'voice of democracy' may have had its electronic 'roots' in .... guess ... a USAID program! >http://www.lewrockwell.com/blog/lewrw/archives/026241.html
reply: Turns out that 'voice of democracy' may have had its electronic 'roots' in .... guess ... a USAID program! >http://www.lewrockwell.com/blog/lewrw/archives/026241.html
title: Moldova Riots after Communists Elected

content: Funny how many of these rioters had cell phones when most could never afford one and many dont even have color TVs in their homes, much less a computer(less than 5% of the population) No one noticed either how many hundreds of Americans were present prior to the elections or that Moldova was once considered an country that would stand up to Moscow. Its true most Moldavians are actually Romanians and has an overwhelmingly older population who dont even understand the concept of democracy. It should not have come as any surprise that there was a 50% vote for the communist party as the last election had a 43% vote for the communists. Also strange to note is how many more Moldavians appear to have twitter accounts than there are active internet connections in the country by a rate of nearly 10 to 1. Are they all crowing around the same computer? Seems to me some more color meddling going on. Since Orange, purple, Rose have already been used and red is surely not a color they would use, what color will they use in another American backed and financed "revolution" Were the elections fair? probably not any less fair than the election in Ukraine that put the corrupt American puppet Yushchenko or the election that put insane Saakashvili in power.

title: Moldova Riots after Communists Elected

content: quote: Originally posted by popsiq: >http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/europe/article6052601.ece Wonder what position Moscow will be taking on Moldova? Will they allow the 'commies' to take power after a national election? Or will they side with the voice of democracy rioting in the streets? The communist won WHAT OBSERVERS SAY WAS A fair ELECTION. So what about the FACT the LOSERS are roiting in the street to overturn the vote theylost makes them the voice of Democracy? The Communist won half the vote and while NONE of the opposition PARTIES (3 main ones) opposing the election results came anywhere CLOSE to the number of votes the Communist got. quote: From Times OnlineApril 7, 2009 The violence came after the Communists won some 50 per cent of the vote in parliamentary elections in the former Soviet republic, where they have been in power since 2001. Under Moldova's constitution, parliament will elect a new president to succeed the Communist leader Vladimir Voronin, who is due to step down after serving the maximum two terms. quote: International observers had judged the election to be fair but the Mayor of Chisinau, Dorin Chirtoaca, alleged that turnout had been inflated to cover up ballot fraud and multiple voting. Mr Chirtoaca is also deputy leader of the opposition Liberal Party. quote: Moldova's three main opposition parties demanded fresh elections to defuse tensions as protesters burnt communist flags and chanted "We want to join Europe" and "We are Romanians". Many were waving Romanian and European Union flags.
quote: Originally posted by popsiq: >http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/news/world/europe/article6052601.ece Wonder what position Moscow will be taking on Moldova? Will they allow the 'commies' to take power after a national election? Or will they side with the voice of democracy rioting in the streets?
reply: The communist won WHAT OBSERVERS SAY WAS A fair ELECTION. So what about the FACT the LOSERS are roiting in the street to overturn the vote theylost makes them the voice of Democracy? The Communist won half the vote and while NONE of the opposition PARTIES (3 main ones) opposing the election results came anywhere CLOSE to the number of votes the Communist got. quote: From Times OnlineApril 7, 2009 The violence came after the Communists won some 50 per cent of the vote in parliamentary elections in the former Soviet republic, where they have been in power since 2001. Under Moldova's constitution, parliament will elect a new president to succeed the Communist leader Vladimir Voronin, who is due to step down after serving the maximum two terms. quote: International observers had judged the election to be fair but the Mayor of Chisinau, Dorin Chirtoaca, alleged that turnout had been inflated to cover up ballot fraud and multiple voting. Mr Chirtoaca is also deputy leader of the opposition Liberal Party. quote: Moldova's three main opposition parties demanded fresh elections to defuse tensions as protesters burnt communist flags and chanted "We want to join Europe" and "We are Romanians". Many were waving Romanian and European Union flags.
title: Moldova Riots after Communists Elected

content: The elections were every bit as fair as the most recent presidential election in the USA. That is not to say I dont support the reunification with Romania because I think its a good idea as 2/3rd of the population are ethnic Romanians anyway and most Moldovians live in extreme poverty that is much worse than in Romania naturally due to the fact that communism/socialism in any form simply doesnt work
